title: henna style ornaments
content:
Good evening all.

So I know henna is a medium, not a style, but I'm wondering if anyone can help recommend an ornamental font (not lettering, but that might be interesting too) that evokes the traditional style of arab and/or asian body art. It needn't necessarily be authentic, just evokative.

So far I've come up with Altemus Arabesques;

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/altemus/arabesques/altemus-arabesques/charm...](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114042448/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/altemus/arabesques/altemus-arabesques/charmap.html "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/altemus/arabesques/altemus-arabesques/charmap.html")

which I think is interesting. Anybody else had fun/been inspired by this kind of work?

Ta,  
Anthony
author: Anthony Noel

comments.content:
Some of Ray Fenwick's work, that he posted [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114042448/http:/typophile.com/node/16510) recently, reminds of henna body art style maybe it is just the density of the ink or the casual yet confident penmanship. [Olduvai](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114042448/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000054) also has some of that feel.  
Tim

Thanks,

Tim, Ray's work is a good reminder of how effective hand drawn stuff can be - there really is no substitute.

Well I can't recollect such font right now however you can checkout Florimel™

[http://www.indiavisitinformation.com/mehndi-design/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114042448/http:/www.indiavisitinformation.com/mehndi-design/ "http://www.indiavisitinformation.com/mehndi-design/")  
You can search for "mehndi designs" in google image search....
